Theoretical Principle / Explanation: Frequent non-canonical word orders reflect topicalization, focus on new or salient information at sentence start or reordered components for emphasis.

Theoretical Principle / Explanation: Reduction or simplification of morphological inflection (e.g., tense, agreement) to shorten constructions and convey present/factual immediacy.
Linguistic Register Concept: Morphological Economy: Fewer inflections signal compressed temporal/aspectual info

Theoretical Principle / Explanation: Structural simplification, such as omitting modifiers or subordination, reduces syntactic complexity.
Linguistic Register Concept: Syntactic Simplification / Parataxis: Preference for simpler, coordinate relations over complex embedding
